alert.note: Alert for Benton; Polk (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 07 at 1:08PM PST until December 07 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Oregon... Luckiamute River near Suver affecting Benton and Polk Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Luckiamute River near Suver. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...Above 27.0 feet, expect flooding of low lying and agricultural lands in the vicinity of Sarah Helmick State Park, Highway 99W, and Parker Road. Some secondary roads and rural access roads may be flooded at this point. Flooding along Buena Vista Rd near the confluence with the Willamette is also likely, especiallly if the Willamette is running high. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:40 PM PST Thursday the stage was 27.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:40 PM PST Thursday was 27.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling through Sunday. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM PST.
